abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome of the Public Sector
            Resource Management Adjustment Project was satisfactory with
            likely sustainability, substantial institutional development
            impact and satisfactory performance by both the Bank and the
            Borrower. The project achieved all its major relevant
            objectives and is expected to achieve relevant development
            results. The outcome was substantially effected by external
            shocks since 1998. Lessons confirm that institutional reform
            is a highly complex and time consuming process. Budget and
            intergovernmental finance reforms require time and capacity
            building to implement, with a long term approach essential.
            Such reforms are dependent on the budget cycle, with risk
            reduced by having a committed government. Fiscal
            decentralization needs effective local accountability to
            provide benefits. Donor commitment is needed to provide
            timely technical assistance and ensure effective burden
            sharing. Reforms in budget management need to be linked to
            administrative and civil service reforms.
